meanings.definition: A period of paid leave granted to a university teacher or other worker for study or travel.
meanings.sent1: During his sabbatical, Professor Smith traveled to Europe to study ancient architecture.
meanings.sent2: She took a sabbatical from teaching to focus on her research project.
meanings.sent3: The sabbatical turned into a fascinating journey of discovery for the professor.
meanings.sent4: His sabbatical was a passport to new knowledge and experiences.
meanings.sent5: The sabbatical rejuvenated his passion for teaching and learning.

meanings.definition: A period of time during which someone does not work at his or her regular job and is able to rest, travel, do research, etc.
meanings.sent1: After a busy year, she decided to take a sabbatical to recharge and explore new hobbies.
meanings.sent2: During his sabbatical, he hiked through the mountains and wrote a book.
meanings.sent3: The sabbatical provided a much-needed break from the daily routine.
meanings.sent4: Her sabbatical was a time to pause and reflect on her career goals.
meanings.sent5: Taking a sabbatical allowed him to return to work with fresh perspectives and ideas.
